dialog: Good day, kind sir. How may I be of assistance?
Good day to you as well. I am here to visit with Rochelle Davis, the Head of the Department of Human Resources.
Do you have a prior appointment with her?
Indeed I do. I am scheduled to meet with her at half past ten this morn.
Very well. May I have your name, please?
Bruce Green, at your service.
Thank you. Please be seated, she will attend to you promptly.
My gratitude, kind sir.
Excuse me, good sir. Might I inquire as to the time?
Ah, it is near the hour of eleven and twenty.
Thank you for your kindness.
You are most welcome. May I observe that the rain is coming down quite heavily today?
Yes, I was in a hurry and alas, I forgot my umbrella.
Fear not, I have one. Would you care to share it as we walk? Which way are you headed?
That is most generous of you. I am bound for the Garden Hotel.
As it happens, I too am headed that way. Shall we make the journey together?
Indeed, I would be delighted to join you.
I am most intrigued by the art of Chinese antiques.
We have a magnificent collection of Chinese antiques, including an array of landscape paintings, portraits, and the most magnificent flower and bird paintings you have ever seen.
I would like to purchase a flower and bird painting, if I may.
